projects.name: Operating Partner
projects.description: Mix Sonoma started as an investment vehicle for a few partners to make angel investments. It was then used as a brand while consulting to young companies. Depending on the situation, operating roles inside a company were taken to accelerate new business and product development. Below are some of those companies and Kevin's full-time roles:

projects.name: Knowing Technologies
projects.description: Partnered with company founder to grow the managed services and coaching business targeting private K-12 schools. Responsible for sales and marketing targeting California schools. Drove 170% year over year revenue growth

projects.name: Hazel Analytics
projects.role: Consultant & Founding Shareholder, Hazel Analytics (Jun 2015 - Oct 2015)
projects.description: Commercialized university research on food safety health outcomes. Changed scoring methodology to something brands would embrace and promote rather than fear. Ran the first marketing campaigns and negotiated the company's first licensing deal in parallel to company formation, IP assignment, and CEO hire. Closed company's first customer in the high six figures.

projects.name: Vector Economics
projects.role: Co-Founder and CEO, Vector Economics (Aug 2010 - May 2015)
projects.description: Vector Economics was a risk management software company. Kevin commercialized a probability distribution technology created by Stanford University professor as a way to better communicate and audit risks. He secured deals with first three paying customers (over $100k each) in financial services, defense and pharmaceutical industries. The core probability distribution technology has since evolved. You may learn more about it at ProbabilityManagement.org

projects.description: Circos is a company that builds brands using virtual reality, digital marketing, and creative storytelling. Invested in and served as CEO of Circos (Brand Karma). The company was acquired in 2017.

He sold and delivered successful multi-million dollar engagements to Global 1000 companies including Nike, NASA, Cadbury-Schweppes and Volkswagen Financial Services AG.

projects.name: Compendit

projects.description: Starting with $60k in savings, Kevin grew the company from 2 - 56 employees with an international subsidiary. The company was sold it to a public company 5 years later for about $13 million.  The Compendit was named a 2001 Hot 100 company by Entrepreneur Magazine.

recommendations.name: Jim Puccetti
recommendations.text: Kevin is a true entrepreneur. His experience as a business leader speaks for itself. I had the pleasure of working with Kevin for over a year. His acute awareness of effective sales strategy and client relations was impressive. Kevin thinks big, and I regularly found myself engaging in creative and forward-thinking conversations with him. He adds enthusiasm to the workplace and understands how to take businesses from good to great. I hope to continue working with Kevin in the future!
